sphere

Class Sphere

  • java.lang.Object
    • sphere.Sphere

  • @ThreadSafe
public class Sphere
extends java.lang.Object
    Client for accessing all Sphere APIs.

    To obtain a thread-safe singleton instance of this class that can be used from all controllers in your application, use the static method getInstance.

    • Method Detail

      • products

        public ProductService products()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with products.

      • categories

        public CategoryTree categories()
        All categories in the project, represented as an in-memory tree. The category tree is initialized just once on startup.

      • orders

        public OrderService orders()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with orders.

      • customers

        public CustomerService customers()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with customers in a given project. Use currentCustomer() for working with the currently logged in customer.

      • reviews

        public ReviewService reviews()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with product reviews.

      • comments

        public CommentService comments()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with product comments.

      • inventory

        public InventoryService inventory()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with product inventory.

      • shippingMethods

        public ShippingMethodService shippingMethods()
        Sphere HTTP API for working with shipping methods.

      • customObjects

        public CustomObjectService customObjects()
        Sphere HTTP API for storing arbitrary JSON data.

      • client

        public SphereClient client()
        Provides access to the low-level Sphere Java client, may you need it to perform tasks that are not common in a typical online shop scenario.

        Using the shop client, you can access all Sphere HTTP API endpoints, so you can for example create shopping carts freely, fetch orders for any customer, etc.

      • currentCart

        @Nonnull
public CurrentCart currentCart()
        Returns a Cart API object for the current request. This object is automatically associated to the current HTTP session, meaning the cart is preserved for a user.
        Returns:
        A cart API object. This method never returns null.

      • getInstance

        public static Sphere getInstance()
        Returns a thread-safe client for accessing the Sphere APIs. The returned instance is designed to be shared by all controllers in your application.

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Returns true if a customer is currently logged in, false otherwise. This is equivalent to currentCustomer() != null but more readable.

      • currentCustomer

        public CurrentCustomer currentCustomer()
        Customer object for the current session.
        Returns:
        The current customer if a customer is logged in, null otherwise.

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String email,
            java.lang.String password)
        Authenticates a customer and stores customer id in the session. If login was successful, currentCustomer() will always return a CurrentCustomer instance, until logout() is called.
        Returns:
        True if the customer was successfully authenticated, false otherwise.

      • loginAsync

        public play.libs.F.Promise<SphereResult<SignInResult>> loginAsync(java.lang.String email,
                                                         java.lang.String password)
        Authenticates an existing customer asynchronously and store customer id in the session when finished.

      • signup

        public SignInResult signup(java.lang.String email,
                  java.lang.String password,
                  CustomerName customerName)
        Creates and authenticates a new customer (you don't have to to call login explicitly).
        Throws:
        EmailAlreadyInUseException - if the email is already taken.

      • signup

        public SignInResult signup(SignUpBuilder signUpBuilder)

      • signupAsync

        public play.libs.F.Promise<SphereResult<SignInResult>> signupAsync(java.lang.String email,
                                                          java.lang.String password,
                                                          CustomerName customerName)
        Creates and authenticates a new customer asynchronously (you don't have to to call login explicitly).
        Returns:
        A result which can fail with the following exceptions:
        • EmailAlreadyInUseException if the email is already taken.

      • signupAsync

        public play.libs.F.Promise<SphereResult<SignInResult>> signupAsync(SignUpBuilder signUpBuilder)

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Removes the customer and cart information from the session.

        After calling logout, currentCustomer() will return null. Make sure you don't keep old CurrentCustomer instances around as they become invalid after logout.
